title: Europe, Middle East & Africa: Citi Invites Its Cardholders to Upgrade with Hotel Privileges
summary: London - Citi announces Hotel Privileges, a program designed to give Citi card members access to tangible benefits at top hotels including best available rates and services such as complimentary breakfast for two, free internet and late check-out - simply for being a Citi customer.
tag-1: Europe, Middle East & Africa: Citi Invites Its Cardholders to Upgrade with Hotel Privileges
tag-3: London – Citi announces Hotel Privileges, a program designed to give Citi card members access to tangible benefits at top hotels including best available rates and services such as complimentary breakfast for two, free internet and late check-out – simply for being a Citi customer.
tag-4: Hotel Privileges provides special access to more than 1,000 luxury hotels around the world including Fairmont Hotels & Resorts, Small Luxury Hotels of the World, Raffles, Swissôtel and many more.
tag-5: "This is the first time we're launching a programme like this anywhere in the world. We're very pleased to offer our customers such a rich set of benefits as we further define the world of rewards and privileges," said John Denhof, Head of Cards at Citi for Europe, the Middle East and Africa. "It's a VIP upgrade and is now one of the many benefits to having a relationship with Citi."
tag-6: "We encourage our customers to take advantage of these great benefits," he added. "They simply need to visit the Hotel Privileges site at https://hotelprivileges.com then choose a hotel or destination, type in the first six digits of their Citi card to receive special discounts and exclusive services."
tag-7: Hotel Privileges is available to all Citi debit and credit card customers in Bahrain, Czech Republic, Egypt, Greece, Hungary, Poland, Russia, Spain, the United Kingdom and the United Arab Emirates. It will soon be available to customers in more countries throughout the world.
tag-9: Each offer includes a combination of:
tag-10: Citibank World Privileges This new offering follows Citibank World Privileges, a world of preferential treatment and benefits, available to Citi card members at www.citiworldprivileges.com. The largest reward program of its kind, Citibank World Privileges has more than 6,000 offers worldwide from fine restaurants and spa centres, to airlines and luxury shops.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
